Messrs. Mudie have great facilities for meeting with
OLD AND SCARCE BOOKS
and will at any time enter the names of such Books
on their Register, and report prices to intending
Purchasers.

For the exchange of Foreign or Juvenile Books,
subscribers may adopt any one of the following methods.
They may exchange as often as they like at the Library,
by Pickford's, rail, or post ; or they may have them
exchanged at their own homes once a week by the Library
vans.
A Juvenile subscription may be added to an existing
Weekly Delivery subscription on the terms quoted for
Town Subscriptions.

NOTICE TO
BOOK-BUYERS
The BOOKSELLING DEPARTMENT of Mudie's
Library has in recent years been Greatly Extended,
and the Show Rooms at New Oxford Street are furnished
with a Well-Selected Stock of the Best Standard and
Modern Books—on Sale at Discount Prices (net publications
excepted), also a fine collection of Favourite Authors in
Handsome Calf and Morocco Bindings, adapted for Private
Libraries and for Gift Books for All Occasions.
SPECIAL FEATURES of the Stock are the Fine Art
and "Colour" Books; Choice Pocket Editions of Classics;
BOOKS for BOYS and GIRLS, and TOY BOOKS for
YOUNG CHILDREN.
Lists forwarded, Post free, on Application,
